Our son was 3 years going 4 years old when we decided to engage AutismSTEP to intervene. In fact, we noticed that he displayed some signs of mild autism since he was about 2-3 years old but we were not sure if it was autism or if it was something he would outgrow.

Our son seemed to be in his own world at times and he would go into meltdown mode if things were changed from what he expected them to be. New experiences were also overly stimulating for him.

What made us seek professional help was that although he was perfectly vocal and speaking in proper sentences at 4 years old, whenever he was in social settings (e.g. playing with other kids at the playground), he would 'roar' at other kids and chase them, then get upset when they didn't want to play with him. When I asked him to tell them nicely that he just wanted to play with them, he cried and said "I don't know how to say it!"

Fauzia was the therapist assigned to work with our son at our home. Initially, our son would throw tantrums whenever he didn't want to do the activities that were planned or if he had to comply to certain behaviours, such as asking for permission to leave the room to get a drink. He would cry and kick and hit.

As the sessions progressed, Fauzia taught our son to communicate his needs/wants and slowly learn to accept that sometimes things don't go the way he expects; that sometimes he may win at games and sometimes he may lose. Our son became more tolerant of 'losing' and of unexpected outcomes. He also learned appropriate behaviours for social settings.

It was a 7-month journey with AutismSTEP and we could see improvements in our son's behaviour. He became more receptive to suggestions by his peers and caregivers on different ways of play, and he learnt to confidently express how he wanted to play with others or do certain activities. Although at times he would still forget to communicate his needs and wants, we recognise that this is still a work-in-progress, and that we could tap on the benefits that the therapy had brought for him and us.

Thank you AutismSTEP and especially to Fauzia for your patience with our son since he started therapy, and also for changing the activity plans to cater to his needs and interests. We are deeply grateful! =)
